words.ENTRY: <H>cable car</H><audio>cable_car.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><NR>1.</NR><D>a vehicle that runs on tracks and is pulled by a moving cable:</D> <X>We took a ride on a cable car in San Francisco.</X><NR>2.</NR><D>a vehicle that hangs from and is pulled by a moving cable, and that carries passengers up and down a mountain:</D> <X>You can go up the Sugar Loaf in Rio on a cable car.</X>
<H>cafe</H><audio>cafe.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><D>a small restaurant that serves drinks and light meals</D>

call1noun1.countablea loud sound that is made to attract attention; a shout: a call for helpThat bird's call is easy to recognize.2.countablean act of telephoning or a conversation on the telephone; a phone call: I'll give you a call this weekend.
a local/long-distance callcall2verb1.call (out) to somebody; call (something) (out) to say something loudly or to shout in order to attract attention: "Hello, is anybody there?" she called.I could hear a voice calling for help.Call the kids. Breakfast is ready.2.to telephone (somebody/something): Who's calling, please?Thank you for calling.I'll call you tomorrow.3.to have as a name: This type of apple is called Golden Delicious.What was that town called?4.to name or describe a person or thing in a certain way:
My name is Elizabeth, but my friends call me Liz.Can you really call this picture "art"?

<H>camping</H><audio>camping.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>uncountable</bracket><D>sleeping or spending a vacation in a tent:</D> <X>Camping is cheaper than staying in hotels.</X><dot><X>a camping trip</X>

can; strong formmodal verb(negative cannot; negative short form can't; past could; past negative could not; past negative short form couldn't) 1.(used for showing that it is possible for somebody/something to do something or that somebody/something has the ability to do something): I can catch a bus from here.Can you ride a bike?He can't speak French.She couldn't answer the question.2.(asking or giving permission): Can I have a drink, please?3.(asking somebody to do something): Can you help me carry these books?4.(offering to do something): Can I help you find anything?

carnouncountable1.a vehicle with an engine and four wheels that up to five or six people can ride in; automobile; auto:
a new/used carWhere can I park the car?They had a car accident.She gave me a ride in her car.to get into/out of a cara sports car2.one of the separate parts of a train: a dining car
a subway car

<H>care</H><audio>care.mp3</audio><PS>verb</PS><CF> care (about something)</CF> <D>to be worried about or interested in something; to mind:</D> <X>I'm going to be late and my mother will be furious, but I don't care.</X>

catchverb(past, past participle caught) 1.to take hold of something that is moving, usually with your hand or hands: She threw the ball and he caught it in one hand.The dog caught the ball in its mouth.2.to get on a form of public transportation: to catch a train/plane3.to get an illness: I have a bad cold. I must have caught it from somebody at work. catch up on something1.to spend time doing something that you have not been able to do until now: I'll have to go into the office this weekend to catch up on my work.2.to find out about things that have happened: Let's have lunch together and catch up on each other's news.
<H>cathedral</H><audio>cathedral.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><D>a large church that is the most important one in a district.</D>

<H>cauliflower</H><audio>cauliflower.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable, uncountable</bracket><D>a large vegetable with green leaves and a round white center that you eat when it is cooked.</D>

cellular phone (informal cell phone)nouncountable
a telephone that you can carry around with you and that works by using radio signals.

<H>change</H><audio>change.mp3</audio><PS>verb</PS><NR>1.</NR><CF>change something (for/into something)</CF> <D>to give somebody money and receive the same amount back in money of a different type:</D> <X>Can you change a twenty-dollar bill?</X><dot><X>I'd like to change a hundred dollars into Swiss francs.</X><NR>2.</NR><D>to become different or to make somebody/something different:</D> <X>This town has changed a lot since I was young.</X><dot><X>Our plans have changed. We leave in the morning.</X><NR>3.</NR><D>to take, have, or use something instead of something else:</D> <X>to change jobs</X><dot><X>to change a light bulb</X><dot><X>to change direction</X>

<H>chaperone</H><su>1</su><audio>chaperone.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><D>an older person who goes to social events for young people to watch them and to make sure that they behave correctly.</D> <H>chaperone</H><su>2</su><audio>chaperone.mp3</audio><PS>verb</PS><D>to act as a chaperone for somebody</D> <DR>unchaperoned</DR><PS>adjective</PS><D>without a chaperone</D>

<H>cheap</H><audio>cheap.mp3</audio><PS>adjective</PS><NR>1.</NR><D>low in price; costing little money:</D> <X>Oranges are cheap at this time of year.</X><dot><X>It's cheaper to buy a round-trip ticket than two one-way tickets.</X><NR>2.</NR><D>charging low prices:</D> <X>There's a cheap restaurant right around the corner.</X>

<H>check</H><audio>check.mp3</audio><PS>verb</PS><NR>1.</NR><D>to examine or look at something in order to make sure that it is safe, correct, in good condition, whether it has changed, etc.:</D> <X>Check your work carefully for mistakes before you hand it in.</X><dot><X>Don't forget to check your e-mail</X> (= to see if you have any new messages) <NR>2.</NR><D>to write a mark that looks like a V on a form, etc. to show your choice, to show that something is done, etc.:</D> <X>Check the box next to the right answer.</X>

<H>cheese</H><audio>cheese.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><NR>1.</NR><bracket>uncountable</bracket><D>a type of solid food that is made from milk. Cheese is usually white or yellow in color:</D> <X>a cheese sandwich</X><dot><X>Sprinkle the top of the pizza with grated cheese.</X><NR>2.</NR><bracket>countable</bracket><D>a type of cheese:</D> <X>a wide selection of cheeses</X>
<H>chef</H><audio>chef.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><D>a person who works as the chief cook in a hotel, restaurant, etc.</D>

<H>chicken</H><audio>chicken.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><NR>1.</NR><bracket>countable</bracket><D>a bird that people keep for its eggs and its meat.</D><NR>2.</NR><bracket>uncountable</bracket><D>the meat of this bird:</D> <X>roast chicken</X><dot><X>a chicken sandwich</X>

chocolatenoun1.uncountablea sweet brown substance that you usually buy in the form of a hard block (a bar). Chocolate is made from cocoa beans: milk/dark chocolate2.countablea small candy that is made from chocolate, usually with a nut or another sweet substance inside: a box of assorted chocolates
citynoun(plural cities) countablea large and important town: Venice is one of the most beautiful cities in the world.

<H>class</H><audio>class.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><NR>1.</NR><bracket>countable</bracket><D>a group of students who are taught together:</D> <X>Jane and I are in the same class at school.</X><dot><X>The whole class is going to the theater tonight.</X><NR>2.</NR><bracket>countable, uncountable</bracket><D>a lesson:</D> <bracket>countable</bracket><X>Classes begin at 9 o'clock in the morning.</X><dot><bracket>uncountable</bracket><X>We watched an interesting video in class.</X> (= during the lesson) <NR>3.</NR><bracket>countable</bracket><D>a course in a particular subject:</D> <X>I'm taking four classes this semester.</X><dot><X>My cooking class starts next Wednesday evening.</X>

clerknouncountable1.a person who sells things to people in a store. 2.a person whose job is to do written work or keep records or accounts in an office, a bank, a court of law, etc. 3.(also desk clerk) a person whose job is dealing with people arriving at or leaving a hotel: Leave your keys with the desk clerk.
click (computing) click (on something) to choose a particular function or item on a computer screen, etc. by pressing one of the buttons on a mouse: Click on the icon to select a document.

<H>climb</H><audio>climb.mp3</audio><PS>verb</PS><NR>1.</NR><D>to go up mountains, etc. as a sport.</D><NR>2.</NR><D>to move up to the top of something:</D> <X>The cat climbed to the top of the tree.</X><dot><X>to climb a tree/mountain/rope</X><dot><X>She climbed the stairs to the attic.</X>

<H>clock</H><audio>clock.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><D>an instrument that shows you what time it is, often found on the wall of a house or building (not worn like a watch):</D> <X>an alarm clock</X>
<H>closet</H><audio>closet.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><D>an area for storing things, with a door, that is built behind the wall of a room:</D> <X>a walk-in closet</X>

<H>clothes</H><audio>clothes.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>plural</bracket><D>the things that you wear, e.g. pants, shirts, dresses, coats, etc. (when thought of all together):</D> <X>Take off those wet clothes.</X><dot><X>She was wearing new clothes.</X>

coffeenoun1.uncountablethe roasted seeds (beans) of a tropical bush, made into powder and used for making a drink: Coffee is the country's biggest export.2.uncountablea drink made by adding hot water to coffee beans that have been made into powder: Would you like tea or coffee?a cup of coffee3.countablea cup of this drink: I'll have a donut and a large coffee with cream and sugar.

<H>coffee shop</H><audio>coffee_shop.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><D>a small informal restaurant where people go to have fast, cheap meals, coffee, and other drinks (but no alcohol)</D>

collegenoun1.(in the United States) countable, uncountablea university where you can study for a degree after you finish high school: a private/public collegecollege students
a college campusHe first got interested in politics when he was in college.2.countableone of the main divisions of some large universities: The history department is part of the College of Arts and Sciences.
<H>colorful</H><audio>colorful.mp3</audio><PS>adjective</PS><D>with bright colors; full of color:</D> <X>a colorful shirt</X>

comeverb(past came; past participle come) 1.to move to or toward the person who is speaking or the place that somebody is talking about: Come here!Come (and) look at this.I hope you can come to my party.They're coming to stay for a week.2.to arrive or reach a place: What time are you coming home?Did the newspaper come yet? how come ...? (informal) why or how: How come you're back so early?How come I didn't get one too? come back to return: I don't know what time I'll be coming back. come from ... to live in or have been born in a place: Where do you come from originally?

<H>comfortable</H><audio>comfortable.mp3</audio><PS>adjective</PS><D>allowing you to feel relaxed and providing you with everything your body needs:</D> <X>Our hotel room was large and comfortable.</X><dot><X>a comfortable temperature</X> (= not too hot or too cold)<dot><X>Sit down and make yourselves comfortable.</X>

<H>complete</H><su>1</su><audio>complete.mp3</audio><PS>verb</PS><NR>1.</NR><D>to make something whole:</D> <X>We need two more players to complete the team.</X><dot><X>I finally managed to complete my collection.</X><NR>2.</NR><D>to finish something; to bring something to an end:</D> <X>When the building has been completed, it will look impressive.</X><dot><X>He completed medical school in 2005.</X><NR>3.</NR><D>to fill out something (e.g. a form):</D> <X>Please complete the following questionnaire in capital letters.</X><dot><X>Completed application forms should be received by December 9.</X><H>complete</H><su>2</su><audio>complete.mp3</audio><PS>adjective</PS><NR>1.</NR><D>having or including all parts; with nothing missing:</D> <X>I gave a complete list of the stolen items to the police.</X><dot><X>The book explains the complete history of the place.</X><NR>2.</NR>(not before a noun) <D>finished or ended:</D> <X>The investigation should be complete by Friday.</X><NR>3.</NR><D>(only before a noun) as great as is possible; total; in every way:</D> <X>the complete reorganization of the department</X><dot><X>It was a complete waste of time.</X>

<H>completely</H><audio>completely.mp3</audio><PS>adverb</PS><D>as much as is possible; totally; in every way:</D> <X>The building was completely destroyed by fire.</X><dot><X>We're trying a completely new method.</X>

<H>concert</H><audio>concert.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><D>a performance of music:</D> <X>a rock concert</X><dot><X>The concert was held in Central Park.</X><dot><X>The orchestra is giving concerts in Cleveland, Columbus, and Cincinnati.</X>
<H>considerate</H><audio>considerate.mp3</audio><PS>adjective</PS><D>careful not to upset people; thinking of others:</D> <X>It was very considerate of you to offer to drive me home.</X>
<H>convenience store</H><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><D>a store that sells food, magazines and other small items, and stays open longer than other stores</D>

<H>conversation</H><audio>conversation.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable, uncountable</bracket><D>informal talk:</D> <bracket>countable</bracket><X>I had a long conversation with her about her plans for the future.</X><dot><bracket>uncountable</bracket><X>His job is his only topic of conversation.</X><dot><X>She finds it difficult to make conversation.</X> (= to think of things to say)

<H>cook</H><audio>cook.mp3</audio><PS>verb</PS><NR>1.</NR><D>to prepare food for eating by heating it:</D> <X>My mother taught me how to cook.</X><dot><X>He cooked us a meal.</X><NR>2.</NR><D>(used about food) to be prepared for eating by being heated:</D> <X>I could smell something cooking in the kitchen.</X>

cooladjective1.(informal) very good; excellent: What a cool car!"There's a party at Dave's tonight." "Cool!"2.(informal) fashionable; popular: A lot of kids think that smoking makes them look cool.3.calm; not excited or affected by strong emotions: She always manages to remain cool under pressure.4.fairly cold; not hot or warm: It was a cool evening, so I put on a sweater.This product should be stored in a cool place.

<H>corner</H><audio>corner.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><D>a place where two lines, edges, surfaces, or roads meet:</D> <X>in a corner of the room</X><dot><X>Write your address in the upper right-hand corner.</X><dot><X>The office is on the corner of Fifth Avenue and 35th Street.</X><dot><X>There's a mailbox around the corner on Walnut Street.</X>

<H>correct</H><su>1</su><audio>correct.mp3</audio><PS>adjective</PS><D>with no mistakes; right or true:</D> <X>Good job! All your answers were correct.</X><dot><X>Be sure you put the correct address on the envelope.</X><H>correct</H><su>2</su><audio>correct.mp3</audio><PS>verb</PS><NR>1.</NR><D>to make a mistake, fault, etc. right or better:</D> <X>to correct a spelling mistake</X><dot><X>to correct a test</X> (= to mark the mistakes in it) <NR>2.</NR><D>to point out the mistakes or faults of somebody:</D> <X>He's always correcting me when I say something wrong.</X>

<H>couch</H><audio>couch.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><D>a comfortable seat with a back and arms. It is long enough for two or more people to sit on; sofa:</D> <X>Don't let the dog sit on the couch!</X>

countrynoun(plural countries) 1.countablean area of land with its own people, government, etc.: Argentina, Brazil, and other South American countriesThere was snow over the northern part of the country last night.2.land which is away from towns and cities: Do you live in the city or the country?country life3.uncountablean area of land (especially considering its physical features): miles of open countryhilly country
<H>crowded</H><audio>crowded.mp3</audio><PS>adjective</PS><D>full of people:</D> <X>The mall was crowded with holiday shoppers.</X><dot><X>a crowded bus</X>
<H>curl</H><audio>curl.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><D>a piece of hair that curves around:</D> <X>Her hair fell in curls around her face.</X>
<H>curly</H><audio>curly.mp3</audio><PS>adjective</PS>(<DR>curlier</DR>; <DR>curliest</DR>) <D>full of curls; shaped like a curl:</D> <X>curly hair</X>
<H>cute</H><audio>cute.mp3</audio><PS>adjective</PS><D>attractive; good-looking:</D> <X>Your little girl is so cute!</X><dot><X>Check out those cute guys over there!</X><dot><X>a cute dress</X>
<H>cycle</H><audio>cycle.mp3</audio><PS>verb</PS><D>to ride a bicycle, especially as a sport</D>
